This document describes the modelling to assess the emerging status of alien species.

# Setup

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, message = FALSE, result = FALSE, tidy='styler')
```

Load libraries:

```{r load_libraries, message = FALSE}
library(tidyverse) # To do data science
library(tidyselect) # To help tidyverse functions
library(tidylog) # To provide feedback on dplyr functions
library(rgbif) # To get information from GBIF
library(lubridate) # To work with dates
library(here) # To find files
library(trias)
library(INBOtheme) # To load graphic INBO theme
```

# Get data

We read the time series data, output of preprocessing pipeline:

```{r read_preprocessed_data, message=FALSE}
df_ts <- read_tsv(
  file = here::here("data", "interim", "df_timeseries.tsv"),
  na = ""
)
```

Columns `pa_obs` and `pa_cobs` indicate the presence (1) or absence (0) of the specific taxon and any other taxa within same class respectively.

Preview:

```{r preview_ts}
# Get a taxon
taxon <-
  df_ts$taxonKey[10]

# Preview
df_ts %>%
  tidylog::filter(
    taxonKey == taxon,
    year %in% c(2016, 2017),
    eea_cell_code == "1kmE3924N3102"
  )
```

Retrieve scientific names which will be useful to better discuss the results.

```{r taxon_names, message=FALSE}
spec_names <- read_tsv(
  file = here::here("data", "interim", "timeseries_taxonomic_info.tsv"),
  na = ""
) %>%
  tidylog::select(taxonKey, canonicalName) %>%
  tidylog::filter(taxonKey %in% df_ts$taxonKey)
```

Lump geographic information:

```{r df_ts_compact}
df_ts_compact <-
  df_ts %>%
  tidylog::group_by(taxonKey, year, classKey) %>%
  tidylog::summarise(
    obs = sum(obs),
    cobs = sum(cobs),
    ncells = sum(pa_obs),
    c_ncells = sum(pa_cobs)
  ) %>%
  tidylog::ungroup()
```

We create a similar data.frame specific to protected areas (Natura2000):

```{r df_ts_compact_protected_areas}
df_ts_compact_prot_areas <-
  df_ts %>%
  tidylog::filter(natura2000 == TRUE) %>%
  tidylog::group_by(taxonKey, year, classKey) %>%
  tidylog::summarise(
    obs = sum(obs),
    cobs = sum(cobs),
    ncells = sum(pa_cobs),
    c_ncells = sum(pa_cobs)
  ) %>%
  tidylog::ungroup()
```

Add canonical names:

```{r add_canonicalName}
df_ts_compact <-
  df_ts_compact %>%
  tidylog::left_join(spec_names, by = "taxonKey")
df_ts_compact_prot_areas <-
  df_ts_compact_prot_areas %>%
  tidylog::left_join(spec_names, by = "taxonKey")
```

# Modelling

In this section we evaluate the emerging status by applying a decision rule strategy or, where possible, a statistical model called GAM (Generalized Additive Models).
For each evaluation year (see below) the output of both models is one of the following emerging status codes:

- `3`: emerging
- `2`: potentially emerging
- `1`: unclear
- `0`: not emerging

See documentation of [`trias::apply_decision_rules`](https://trias-project.github.io/trias/reference/apply_decision_rules.html) and [`trias::apply_gam()`](https://trias-project.github.io/trias/reference/apply_gam.html) for more information.

## Define evaluation period 

We define the time window (in years) we want to assess the emerging status:

```{r eval_years}
# Last evaluation year
last_year <- lubridate::year(Sys.Date()) - 2

# First evaluation year
first_year <- last_year - 2

# Evaluation years
evaluation_years <- seq(first_year, last_year)
evaluation_years
```

We remove recent data due to publishing delay. Underestimation of the number of observations would sensibly affect the GAM output.

```{r remove_actual_year}
df_ts_compact <-
  df_ts_compact %>%
  tidylog::filter(year <= last_year)
df_ts_compact_prot_areas <-
  df_ts_compact_prot_areas %>%
  tidylog::filter(year <= last_year)
```

## Remove appearing taxa

Taxa appearing after the very first evalution year should be removed as no trend can be assesed for them. See [analysis of appearing and reappearing taxa](https://trias-project.github.io/indicators/06_occurrence_indicators_appearing_taxa.html).

```{r remove_appearing_taxa}
appearing_taxa_to_remove <-
  df_ts_compact %>%
  tidylog::group_by(taxonKey) %>%
  tidylog::summarize(begin_year = min(year)) %>%
  tidylog::filter(begin_year > min(evaluation_years)) %>%
  dplyr::pull(taxonKey)

df_ts_compact <-
  df_ts_compact %>%
  tidylog::filter(!taxonKey %in% appearing_taxa_to_remove)

df_ts_compact_prot_areas <-
  df_ts_compact_prot_areas %>%
  tidylog::filter(!taxonKey %in% appearing_taxa_to_remove)

spec_names <-
  spec_names %>%
  tidylog::filter(!taxonKey %in% appearing_taxa_to_remove)
```

## Decision rules

We define and apply some decision rules for occupancy and observations in all Belgium and in protected areas using function `apply_decision_rules()` from project package `trias`.

### Observations

#### Belgium

We apply function `apply_decision_rules()` to observations for all Belgium:

```{r apply_decision_rules_occs_be, message=FALSE}
em_decision_rules_occs_BE <- purrr::map_dfr(
  evaluation_years,
  ~ apply_decision_rules(
    df = df_ts_compact,
    y_var = "obs",
    eval_year = .
  )
)
```

Examples:

```{r example_dec_rules_occs_BE}
em_decision_rules_occs_BE %>% tidylog::slice_head(n = 10)
```

#### Protected areas

We apply function `apply_decision_rules()` to observations for protected areas:

```{r apply_decision_rules_occs_pa, message=FALSE}
em_decision_rules_occs_pa <- purrr::map_dfr(
  evaluation_years,
  ~ apply_decision_rules(
    df = df_ts_compact_prot_areas,
    y_var = "obs",
    eval_year = .
  )
)
```

Examples:

```{r example_dec_rules_occs_pa}
em_decision_rules_occs_pa %>% tidylog::slice_head(n = 10)
```

## Generalized additive model (GAM)

We apply GAM to observations and occupancy in all Belgium and in protected areas using function `trias::apply_gam()` from project package `trias`.

Plots are saved in `./data/output/GAM_outputs`:

```{r plots_dir}
dir_name <- here::here("data", "output", "GAM_outputs")
```

### Observations

#### Belgium

Apply GAM for observation data in all Belgium:

```{r apply_gam_to_all_taxa, message=FALSE, cache=TRUE}
taxon_keys <- unique(df_ts_compact$taxonKey)
taxon_names <- unique(df_ts_compact$canonicalName)
gam_occs_BE <- map2(
  taxon_keys, taxon_names,
  function(t, n) {
    df_key <- df_ts_compact %>%
      dplyr::filter(taxonKey == t)
    class_key <- unique(df_key[["classKey"]])
    if (!is.na(class_key)) {
      results_gam <- trias::apply_gam(
        df = df_key,
        y_var = "obs",
        taxonKey = "taxonKey",
        eval_years = evaluation_years,
        type_indicator = "observations",
        taxon_key = t,
        name = n,
        baseline_var = "cobs",
        dir_name = dir_name,
        saveplot = TRUE
      )
    } else {
      results_gam <- trias::apply_gam(
        df = df_key,
        y_var = "obs",
        eval_years = evaluation_years,
        type_indicator = "observations",
        taxon_key = t,
        name = n,
        dir_name = dir_name,
        saveplot = TRUE
      )
    }
    return(results_gam)
  }
)
names(gam_occs_BE) <- taxon_keys
```

Show results for _Hydrocotyle ranunculoides_ and _Trachemys scripta elegans_:

```{r show_results_preview_occs_BE, message=FALSE}
gam_occs_BE$`7978544`$plot
gam_occs_BE$`6157026`$plot
```

#### Protected aras

Apply GAM for observation data in protected areas:

```{r apply_gam_observations_to_all_taxa_protected_areas, message=FALSE, cache=TRUE}
taxon_keys <- unique(df_ts_compact_prot_areas$taxonKey)
taxon_names <- unique(df_ts_compact_prot_areas$canonicalName)
gam_occs_pa <- map2(
  taxon_keys, taxon_names,
  function(t, n) {
    df_key <- df_ts_compact_prot_areas %>%

    class_key <- unique(df_key[["classKey"]])
    if (!is.na(class_key)) {
      trias::apply_gam(
        df = df_key,
        y_var = "obs",
        eval_years = evaluation_years,
        type_indicator = "observations",
        taxon_key = t,
        name = n,
        baseline_var = "cobs",
        df_title = "Natura2000",
        dir_name = dir_name,
        saveplot = TRUE
      )
    } else {
      trias::apply_gam(
        df = df_key,
        y_var = "obs",

        type_indicator = "observations",
        taxon_key = t,
        name = n,
        df_title = "Natura2000",
        dir_name = dir_name,
        saveplot = TRUE
      )
    }
  }
)
names(gam_occs_pa) <- taxon_keys
```

### Occupancy

#### Belgium

Apply GAM for occupancy data (number of occupied cells) in all Belgium:

```{r apply_gam_occupancy_to_all_taxa, message=FALSE, cache=TRUE}
taxon_keys <- unique(df_ts_compact$taxonKey)
taxon_names <- unique(df_ts_compact$canonicalName)
gam_occupancy_BE <- map2(
  taxon_keys, taxon_names,
  function(t, n) {
    df_key <- df_ts_compact %>%
      dplyr::filter(taxonKey == t) %>%
      dplyr::filter(year <= max(evaluation_years))
    class_key <- unique(df_key[["classKey"]])
    if (!is.na(class_key)) {
      trias::apply_gam(
        df = df_key,
        y_var = "ncells",
        eval_years = evaluation_years,
        type_indicator = "occupancy",
        taxon_key = t,
        name = n,
        baseline_var = "c_ncells",
        dir_name = dir_name,
        saveplot = TRUE,
        y_label = "occupancy (km2)"
      )
    } else {
      trias::apply_gam(
        df = df_key,
        y_var = "ncells",
        eval_years = evaluation_years,
        type_indicator = "occupancy",
        taxon_key = t,
        name = n,
        dir_name = dir_name,
        saveplot = TRUE,
        y_label = "occupancy (km2)"
      )
    }
  }
)
names(gam_occupancy_BE) <- taxon_keys
```

Show results for _Hydrocotyle ranunculoides_ and _Trachemys scripta elegans_:

## Plots

We create a zip file with all generated plots:

```{r create-zip-file}
folder_path <- here::here("data", "output", "GAM_outputs")
zip(zipfile = here::here("data", "output", "GAM_outputs", "plots.zip"),
    files = list.files(folder_path,
                       pattern = ".png$",
                       full.names = TRUE,
                       recursive = FALSE)
)
```
